docs.text:
Welcome to ProxyBuilder


Here we will describe the ProxyBuilder from 
github.com/ProxyBuilder/proxybuilder


The project-target is a Builder-Framework for creating different types of proxies. 
You will find three main groups of proxies.




DynamicProxies


ObjectAdapter


StaticProxies




If you want to have an overview of the Proxy-Pattern itself I can recommend
the following sources.


engl:




(soon) a free gitbook about Pattern and more 
Java Fundamentals in english




german:




a book written by Dr. Heinz Kabutz und me 
amazon


a free gitbook about Pattern and more 
Java Fundamentals




Some examples


DynamicProxyBuilder


SNAPSHOTS


If you are using maven you could add the following to your settings.xml to get the snapshots that are available at maven-central. 


   
profile

      
id
allow-snapshots
/id

      
activation

        
activeByDefault
true
/activeByDefault

      
/activation

      
repositories

        
repository

          
id
snapshots-repo
/id

          
url
https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots
/url

          
releases

            
enabled
false
/enabled

          
/releases

          
snapshots

            
enabled
true
/enabled

            
updatePolicy
always
/updatePolicy

          
/snapshots

        
/repository

      
/repositories

    
/profile





The developer-SNAPSHOTS are available there. You can reference them as usual.
For example:


      
dependency

        
groupId
org.rapidpm.proxybuilder
/groupId

        
artifactId
rapidpm-proxybuilder-modules-builder
/artifactId

        
version
${rapidpm.version}
/version

      
/dependency






The actual version (2015.11.05) is 
0.0.4-SNAPSHOT
.
docs.title: Home

docs.text:
Here we will describe the ProxyBuilder from  github.com/ProxyBuilder/proxybuilder  The project-target is a Builder-Framework for creating different types of proxies. 
You will find three main groups of proxies.   DynamicProxies  ObjectAdapter  StaticProxies   If you want to have an overview of the Proxy-Pattern itself I can recommend
the following sources.  engl:   (soon) a free gitbook about Pattern and more  Java Fundamentals in english   german:   a book written by Dr. Heinz Kabutz und me  amazon  a free gitbook about Pattern and more  Java Fundamentals
docs.title: Welcome to ProxyBuilder

docs.text:
If you are using maven you could add the following to your settings.xml to get the snapshots that are available at maven-central.       profile 
       id allow-snapshots /id 
       activation 
         activeByDefault true /activeByDefault 
       /activation 
       repositories 
         repository 
           id snapshots-repo /id 
           url https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots /url 
           releases 
             enabled false /enabled 
           /releases 
           snapshots 
             enabled true /enabled 
             updatePolicy always /updatePolicy 
           /snapshots 
         /repository 
       /repositories 
     /profile   The developer-SNAPSHOTS are available there. You can reference them as usual.
For example:         dependency 
         groupId org.rapidpm.proxybuilder /groupId 
         artifactId rapidpm-proxybuilder-modules-builder /artifactId 
         version ${rapidpm.version} /version 
       /dependency   The actual version (2015.11.05) is  0.0.4-SNAPSHOT .
docs.title: SNAPSHOTS

docs.text:
DynamicProxy


Since jdk1.3 the DynamicProxy is part of the JDK. 
The official documentation/API-Doc for JDK8 you can find 

here


VirtualProxy


AddMetrics


MethodScoped


PreAction


PostAction

docs.text:
Welcome to ProxyBuilder


For full documentation visit 
mkdocs.org
.


Commands




mkdocs new [dir-name]
 - Create a new project.


mkdocs serve
 - Start the live-reloading docs server.


mkdocs build
 - Build the documentation site.


mkdocs help
 - Print this help message.




Project layout


mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: About
